chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ralph M Blair was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not possess or consume alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

2/2/15 proceedings

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Called at 1:29 PM. Ralph Blair appears in person and in custody with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have resolution - defendant will plead G to  count #1 as alleged, DRI #2 and #3, joint recommendation of 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving, with conditions of: fine of $2985.00, reimburse City of Crandon for costs of blood draw of $35.00, DL suspension of 36 months, IID, AODA, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment, 300 hours of community service, no objections to the defendant being eligible for earned release program. Burns and Blair agree. Blair pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for eligibility for earned release for stated reasons. Blair makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement - consecutive to FC Case #12CF161, followed by 3 years of ES with ES conditions of: $2985.00 - paid thru ES, costs for blood draw of $35.00 (City of Crandon) - paid thru ES, AODA and follow thru, DL revocation of 3 years, IID on DL and any vehicle titled in his name for 1 year commencing upon issuance of valid DL, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, will make the defendant eligible for earned release, right to appeal, adjourned.
State
Pre-trial conference at 02-02-2015 01:30 pm
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 10:22 AM. Ralph Blair appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns - will waive PH today. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, reviews complaint and finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for PTC on 2/2/15 at 1:00 PM (backing up a JT).
Preliminary hearing on January 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.
and Certificate of Appearance - Police Officer DW

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:52 AM. Ralph Blair appears via video from FOSO and with counsel Mary Burns appearing in person. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Burns and Blair have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH, waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 1/7/15 at 3:00 PM.
defendant
Adjourned initial appearance on December 3, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Called at 10:21 AM. Ralph Blair appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Jodie Bednar Clemens. Blair does have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Blair understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney - cannot afford his own - states he was appointed Mary Burns from SPD. Court instructs that Ms. Burns is unavailable today for stated reasons. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 12/3/14 at 9:15 AM.
No consumption of alcohol.
Cash set.
